skill.name: engineering-nba-data
skill.description: Extracts, transforms, and analyzes NBA statistics using the nba_api Python library. Use when working with NBA player stats, team data, game logs, shot charts, league statistics, or any NBA-related data engineering tasks. Supports both stats.nba.com endpoints and static player/team lookups.
skill.summary: Extracts, transforms, and analyzes NBA statistics using the nba_api Python library.
skill.author: Emz1998

security_audit.summary: The skill is a documentation and example set for the `nba_api` library. Static analysis flagged numerous false positives related to markdown formatting (backticks), documentation links (URLs), and common terms (system reconnaissance). No actual malicious code or high-risk patterns were found in the content.

content.value_statement: Streamline your NBA data analysis with a comprehensive toolkit for accessing and processing stats.nba.com data. Retrieve player stats, team data, game logs, and live scores efficiently with Python-based automation.
actual_capabilities: Retrieve comprehensive player and team career statistics from stats.nba.com
Access live game data including box scores, play-by-play, and scoreboards
Fetch static player and team metadata for ID lookups without API calls
Analyze league-wide standings, leaders, and hustle stats
Extract draft history and combine results for prospect analysis
limitations: Rate limits apply to stats.nba.com API endpoints
Live data endpoints may not support pandas DataFrame output directly
Data availability depends on the NBA`s official statistics service uptime

best_practices: Always use static lookups for player/team IDs to avoid unnecessary API calls.
Cache API responses to respect rate limits and improve performance.
Use `get_data_frames()` for analysis in notebooks and `get_json()` for web applications.
anti_patterns: Making API calls inside a loop without delays (triggers rate limiting).
Hardcoding player/team IDs instead of using dynamic lookups.
Ignoring endpoint specific parameters required for accurate data retrieval.

faq.question: Is an API key required?
faq.answer: No, the nba_api library accesses public endpoints that do not require an API key.

faq.question: Can I get historical data?
faq.answer: Yes, the API supports historical data going back several decades.

faq.question: Does it support WNBA or G-League?
faq.answer: Yes, you can specify `LeagueID` parameters (WNBA=`10`, G-League=`20`) for many endpoints.

faq.question: Why am I getting a timeout?
faq.answer: stats.nba.com can be slow or rate-limit aggressive; try increasing the timeout or adding delays.

faq.question: Can I get play-by-play data?
faq.answer: Yes, specific endpoints like `playbyplayv2` provide detailed game event data.

faq.question: Is pandas required?
faq.answer: It`s highly recommended for data processing, but you can also work with raw dictionaries or JSON.
